comments.body:
I think they should add a violin noteblock sound...
But not with soulsoil. I just don't think it fits.
With a loom instead ðŸ˜‚
Maybe if you beat the game on one of your files, you can have the option to turn that on. It could also unlock a new title screen for bragging rights if you get all of the achievements.
Or just only an option to enable or disable the music
If i hear that music i will play fairly
Or just mute music in the sound menu
Yes, but who wants to do that? It would be a lot more convenient to have it be done automatically.
Yeah, the only really metallic sounds currently are for chains....
It sounds nice

I'm also deaf in my left ear! Recently my only good set of headphones broke, so I have been using my earbuds to play Minecraft with. I have found that it is much harder to hear a creeper igniting when it is on my left, which has imaginably caused me much trouble. The ability to toggle mono sound would help immensely! Thank you.

Yeah, this is a pretty important feature! I myself have been deaf in my right ear since birth. The subtitle feature helps, but it is hard to enjoy the music discs in Minecraft when you turn away from the jukebox and the music fades out completely. Such a bummer! But hopefully this feature can be added...

I think this would be a great feature to add - if not for the accessibility then for the fact that it is really hard to enjoy music discs in stereo sound if you're not directly facing it the whole song length

Bumping this, there was another suggestion for a new /playmusic command which could be useful too but generally fading sounds and playing them from a specific timestamp would be great. It would allow mapmakers to create layered sound which would make for some very immersive music systems.
The instrument played depends on the block below the note block.
yeah, i need to change the description, but i think there should be one for each basic drum kit piece. and also some way to change octaves(for the pitch)
Maybe you should be able to use dye on noteblocks to change the pitch.

omg yes!!! i couldnt think of how this could be done but that would work! and then there could be a coloured border, band or corners to show the octave. but it would have to be in groups, for example red orange and yellow count as one octave, then green blue and purple would be another... and you get the point. it should have be equal to the number of notes or octaves as a standard piano or guitar
i keep forgetting to change the description. ill do it as soon as i can
I suggest heavy notebooks. I think petrified wood is a feature. Right?
Note blocks definitely need much larger octave range. There are so many songs I want to make but they keep going out of the range of noteblocks

Definitely agree with the drum set idea. Desperately needed! I'm not to keen on the dye idea though. Maybe it would be better if dye could be used to change the duration a note is played? Pitch can easily be adjusted as of right now by just punching the noteblock.
Maybe it could wake you earlier than normal, just as the sun is rising.

it's silly but that's what I like about it

 

COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO!

Yes yes yes!
I have pet chickens and it sounds so nice when they crow!

Length would be a great change, and the solution seems simple to me - as long as the block is powered, the note plays. I don't think volume is nearly as important, but if it were added, signal strength seems like a natural way to go.
I don't think the volume would be that interesting as you could just place 2 note blocks, however change the length would be so useful as there isn't a way to do it currently

YES! As a Minecraft and music fan, I've made my fair share of note block music. The fact that the note played is so short, makes a lot of music sound...off. I would love to see this.

There aren't even any mods out there that add this. I wish i knew how to program so i could make my own.

But i know that Mojang does.
Please its now the year 2024 but we are still unable to adj lenght of the note being played on a noteblock
Moved to Sounds.
It's ideas like this that make me smile.
this would either be the best or worst thing ever added to Minecraft... I'm on board either way!
C418 was removed?
or at least put all their music in the game
It's a cool idea but not very useful cuz people can just use a resource pack.
Hey! Adding possibility to record in game music would be just amazing!
Thank you.
Yes but someone can put something inappropriate on a music disc and play it on a Minecraft server with some innocent little kids
Pls read the post
Does minecraft have any inappropriate sounds. No I though so.
Rescources packs does have limitations such as only being able to alter the exsiting music disks. While the Blank music disk can create infinitly more.
What about a "blank" disc that can play any sound file in the game based on how it is named.

i think this would be really useful, like have some background noise so players can make a kinda 5, 11, and 13 style disks. it could be kinda like how maps work. so everything on the disk is recorded from the position of the recorder into a mono recording track. so if players want to, they could copy existing music disks by placing the recorder and the jukebox next to eachother but the sound quality wouldnt be as good

If I had to chose some blocks for brass instruments:

  • Trumpets: Honeycomb blocks (they're pretty useless blocks anyway)
  • Trombone: Ancient Debris (or Soul Soil if that's too expensive)
Trumpets would be a great addition. Maybe add some strings on top of it, like a violin.
They could be placed on top of the new copper block

Yeah currently there is not a single brass instrument, I feel like even a simple trumpet could massively expand the things you could do with noteblocks. It would make the most sense to use copper but maybe the different stages could be like different instruments such as trombone for slightly weathered and tuba for fully oxidized etc. Maybe there could even be different sounds depending on whether its cut or not.

I want to make Star Wars music with note blocks. This requires brass instruments. You can't have Star Wars without brass.

I like the idea of using copper blocks for this. Here's the breakdown I think would probably work:

  • Tuba - regular copper block
  • Trombone - cut copper block
  • Trumpet - raw copper block
I don't know how to change the name I have, my friend made it for me a while ago as a joke. Sorry.
The only sign there is a blaze nearby is my burning body
It's utterly ridiculous that blaze can shoot you from so far away that you don't have any clue they're attacking until you're on fire and knocked off the walkway. How is that fun?

I like this idea, but honestly, I think that getting Dog should be as simple as adding it to the mob spawner loot table. Itâ€™d be nice to show those loot tables some love and would add some variety to the millions of cat and 13 discs we find. Plus, since dog was originally at the end of Cat, I think it makes sense that they would be found in the same way. I love the Dog track and feel very strongly that this should be added back! The track already exists in game and the item art should be easy, please consider this, it would make my day Mojang!
Sounds Great! I Know a musician who does good stuff to - they recently did a video using only resampled noteblock sounds : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4cbuDc67k8
Hey I know they could play Minecraft original song but backwards then edit it if it doesn't sound good.
That's a graphic, this is sound. I've put it in the right category for you. :)

Sorry, I thought of this as an item-feature but it is obviously a sound-feature. (I've been browsing via the search box.)

Thanks Inkycatz!
Always glad to help posts find the home that will help them succeed! Good luck with your idea.
Ù†Ø¹Ù… Ø§Ù†Ø§ Ù…Ø¹Ùƒ

yes that will help alot

Iâ€™m with your idea
how bout' both can be added
Preferably a unique, cool sound.
Agreed, though it shouldn't be as dramatic as the End Portal sound since they can be created wherever if you have the resources.. There should be a sound for deactivation as well.
Mojang should add this to 1.16
I'd like it to have a similar sound to the End Portal being opened: perhaps the sound of a lightning strike accompanied by a ghast's echoing scream.

Maybe some optional ambience, I play solo, and really having some more particle "bugs" like firefly concepts would add a lot of ambiance, but I could dial it up or down with the particle effect controls. I rarely have the music on, and honestly could use some individual sound controls, rain can be deafinging, cow mooing constantly annoying, and random minecart noises confusing.

cheez

They may not consider it than to have all soundtrack in the game treated as just MC music. For people who want it separated, they have options to do it themselves by turning off in-game music and playing selected soundtracks from an outside source (music streaming site or personal playlists), or use mods or datapacks that remove the new additions.
